item.title: Ransomware attacks zoom as bitcoin's use grows
item.description:
Ransomware attacks zoom as bitcoin's use grows

According to the U.S. Department of Justice, ransomware attacks have quadrupled this year from a year ago, averaging 4,000 a day, reports the Wall Street Journal (WSJ). Although ransomware dates ba...

item.title: Litecoin Price Dips Again As GDAX Hype Dies Down
item.description:
Litecoin Price Dips Again As GDAX Hype Dies Down

After news recently broke about GDAX adding litecoin to their platform, there was some initial excitement. Many people hoped this would be the moment where Litecoin would finally take off and soar to higher values. Unfortunately, none of that has happened so far, and it looks like GDAX is seeing very little LTC trading volume.

item.title: Moscow's Active Citizen Project to Implement Blockchain
item.description:
Moscow's Active Citizen Project to Implement Blockchain

Speaking at the meeting with the Russian president's administration, Deputy Director of Moscow's IT Department, Andrei Belozerov, stated that they were ready to implement blockchain technology in the project dubbed Active Citizen. "Moscow is ready to become a platform for using blockchain technology. As a pilot project, we're offering the Active Citizen project.

item.title: R3 Consortium Files Patent Application For Corda
item.description:
R3 Consortium Files Patent Application For Corda

Most people know the R3 Consortium for their blockchain efforts. A project called Corda was announced not too long ago, which acts as a permissioned distributed ledger. Ever since, the team has been working filing a patent for this software.

item.title: Turkish Bitcoin Exchange BTCTurk Shuts Down For Good
item.description:
Turkish Bitcoin Exchange BTCTurk Shuts Down For Good

Running a Bitcoin exchange is no easy feat by any means. BTCTurk, one o f the cryptocurrency exchange platforms active in Turkey since 2013, has been forced to shut down their operations recently. This is odd news, considering Paypal pulling out of Turkey could have elevated Bitcoin usage.

item.title: Economists Expect SWIFT to Be Superseded by Blockchain
item.description:
Economists Expect SWIFT to Be Superseded by Blockchain

The news suggesting that several major banks are about to develop a new digital currency have agitated both crypto-community and professional economists. One of the first to comment the news was Kirill Yakovenko, a financial analyst, who told REGNUM that, within the next two or three years, cryptocurrencies would walk out of shadows, and new international financial tools would emerge.

item.title: Blocksafe Announces ICO Sponsored by Blockchain Foundation
item.description:
Blocksafe Announces ICO Sponsored by Blockchain Foundation

Blockchain-based smart gun system, Blocksafe, is getting ready to move forward with its vision by launching a crowd sale for its new token and extending its main blockchain with the help of Lisk. Also read: Lisk Unveils Long-Term Development Roadmap Blocksafe is issuing a new token called "Trigger" (TRIG), which will be used as the primary token on the chain.

item.title: The Shadow Brokers Release More Potent Exploits To The Public
item.description:
The Shadow Brokers Release More Potent Exploits To The Public

The Shadow Brokers continue to make a name for themselves. Although their Bitcoin auction is not seeing much success, the group recently leaked some Cisco firewall exploits. After those security holes had been fixed, the exploits were quickly upgraded to attack more recent versions of ASA.

item.title: Why doesn't China have more bitcoin nodes?
item.description:
Why doesn't China have more bitcoin nodes?

Answer: China is a closed monetary system. Its slightly more difficult to bring money into China, and its pretty much impossible to get money in large quantities out. So Bitcoin is another mechanism for getting money out of of the country, and that's why they are banned. Why has china banned bit...

item.title: How do you create a transaction from a UTXO in BitcoinJ?
item.description:
How do you create a transaction from a UTXO in BitcoinJ?

Is there a way to construct and send a transaction in BitcoinJ without a wallet? I just want to build my transaction from a utxo and broadcast it.
